text: Jarret Webster Johnson (born August 14, 1981) is an American former professional football outside linebacker. He played 12 seasons in the National Football League (NFL). He played for the Baltimore Ravens and San Diego Chargers. He played college football at the University of Alabama. Johnson appreciated as an "unsung hero" and defensive leader by Baltimore fans. Johnson scored two career touchdowns and was a steady presence on a great Ravens defense. On March 14, 2012, Johnson signed a 4-year contract with the San Diego Chargers. On February 24, 2015, Johnson announced that he was retiring from playing professional football. ==References== Category:1981 births Category:Living people Category:American football linebackers Category:Sportspeople from Florida Category:Baltimore Ravens players Category:San Diego Chargers players
title: Jarret Johnson
